subject: Re: [junit] [ANN] EMMA: a free and fast code coverage tool
msgSnippet: ... Yes, you can use it in place of Clover (several account teams at my company have switched and I am getting emails from external users to the same effect as
messageBody:
> Vlad R wrote:
>
> > EMMA (http://emma.sourceforge.net) is a Java code
> > coverage tool based on bytecode instrumentation.
> Whilst not the only
> > tool on the market right now, EMMA strives to be
> different by being
> > very lightweight, flexible, and fast.
>
> Has anyone integrated EMMA into Maven? Can I use it
> in place of Clover?

Yes, you can use it in place of Clover (several
account teams at my company have switched and I am
getting emails from external users to the same effect
as well). Of course, there will always be feature
differences between source code instrumentation-based
(Clover), bytecode instrumentation-based (EMMA), and
JVMPI-based tools (many other commercial tools).

No, EMMA has not been integrated into Maven (yet),
although this has been much requested as soon as it
was published outside of Trilogy. This feature will be
implemented in near future (another developer is
joining the project soon specifically to address this
area) but I don't think this is a gate for starting to
use EMMA now.
